text: John Edward Drew (September 30, 1954 â€“ April 10, 2022) was an American professional basketball player. He played as a small forward. He played eleven seasons in the National Basketball Association (NBA) from 1974 until 1984 for the Atlanta Hawks and Utah Jazz. Drew was a two-time NBA All-Star. Drew was born in Vredenburgh, Alabama. Drew died of bone cancer on April 10, 2022 in Houston, Texas at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Atlanta Hawks players Category:Utah Jazz players Category:Sportspeople from Alabama
title: John Drew (basketball)
